Package contextualegonetwork

Class ContextualEgoNetwork

  • java.lang.Object
    • contextualegonetwork.ContextualEgoNetwork
  • public class ContextualEgoNetwork
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements a Contextual Ego Network, that is the conceptual model of our Heterogeneous Social Graph. It contains information about the various contexts, i.e. the different layers of the multi-layer network, and about the nodes (users) that belong to the contexts. Moreover, it divides the contexts into a current one, some active ones (that are kept in memory) and some inactive ones (that are serialized in dedicated files).

    • Constructor Detail

      • ContextualEgoNetwork

        public ContextualEgoNetwork​(java.lang.String egoName,
                            java.lang.Long nodeId)
        Contexts are stored in ./ContextData directory. Instances gets own contexts from that directory, but remember that egoname in these contexts needs to be equal to egoName param.(data persistence) Snapshots of contexts for data analysis are stored in ./AnalyticsContextData. If the two directories already existed, the application tries to retrieve pre-existing serialized contexts by deserialization.
        Parameters:
        egoName - Name of ego for all contexts
        nodeId - The identifier of the ego
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if egoName or nodeId are null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if contextName is an empty string

    • Method Detail

      • newContext

        public Context newContext​(java.lang.String contextName,
                          java.util.function.BiFunction f)
        Creates a new context and adds it to the active contexts. It also creates the correspondent layer. Successive calls with the same ContextName, will replace the previous context value if the context has not been saved at least once.
        Parameters:
        contextName - Identifier of the context
        f - The translation function of the context
        Returns:
        The new context just created in the CEN
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If contextName is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the context already exists (is already serialized)

      • newLayer

        private void newLayer​(Context c,
                      java.util.function.BiFunction f)
        Creates a new layer in the CEN. This method is protected, and it is invoked by the CEN object whenever a context is created.
        Parameters:
        c - The context encapsulated in the layer
        f - The function to be associated to the layer
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If c is null

      • deleteLayer

        public boolean deleteLayer​(java.lang.String contextName)
        Deletes a layer identified by its encapsulated context name. Subsequently, the context is also deleted (if it hasn't been already deleted).
        Parameters:
        contextName - The name of the context whose layer has to be deleted.
        Returns:
        True if the elimination has been successful, false otherwise (if the context doesn't exist)
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if contextName is null

        Parameters:
        contextName - The name of the context
        Returns:
        The layer that encapsulates the context identified by contextName, null if it doesn't exist
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if contextName is null

        public void saveContext​(java.lang.String contextName)

        Parameters:
        contextName - Identifier of the context
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If contextName is null
        ContextException - If contextName isn't an identifier of a valid context, or is an identifier of a non active context

        public void setInactive​(java.lang.String contextName)

        Parameters:
        contextName - The name of the context to be set to inactive
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If contextName is null
        ContextException - If contextName isn't an identifier of a valid context, or is an identifier of a non active context

        public int addEdge​(java.lang.String src,
                   java.lang.String dst)
        Adds an edge to the current context
        Parameters:
        src - Identifier of the source node
        dst - Identifier of the dst node
        Returns:
        0 if the edge has been added successfully, -1 otherwise (if Context.addEdge method fails)
        Throws:

        ContextException - If there is no current context

      • addEdge

        public int addEdge​(java.lang.String contextName,
                   java.lang.String src,
                   java.lang.String dst)
        Adds an edge to a context identified by contextName Context is set to current context and loaded if necessary.
        Parameters:
        src - Identifier of the source node
        dst - Identifier of the dst node
        contextName - The name of the context
        Returns:
        0 if the edge has been added su successfully, -1 otherwise (if Context.addEdge method fails)
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If src, dst or contextName is null

      • removeEdge

        public boolean removeEdge​(java.lang.String src,
                          java.lang.String dst)
        Removes the edge from src to dst in the current context. if the edge exists, but it is the only one that connects the ego to another node : the node is removed because it has no relationship with the ego(egonetwork rep invariant)
        Parameters:
        src - Identifier of the source node
        dst - Identifier of the dst node
        Returns:
        true if the edge is deleted correctly, false if also src or dst have been deleted
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If src or dst are null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If src is equal to dest

      • removeEdge

        public boolean removeEdge​(java.lang.String contextName,
                          java.lang.String src,
                          java.lang.String dst)
        Removes the edge from src to dst in the context. If the edge exists, but it is the only one that connects the ego to another node : the node is removed because it has no relationship with the ego(egonetwork rep invariant). Context is set to current context and loaded if necessary.
        Parameters:
        contextName - Identifier of the context
        src - Identifier of the source node
        dst - Identifier of the dst node
        Returns:
        true if the edge is deleted correctly, false if also src or dst have been deleted.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if src, dst or contextName are null

      • addNode

        public boolean addNode​(java.lang.String contextName,
                       java.lang.String nodeName,
                       java.lang.Long nodeId)
        Adds the node to the context together with the arc that connects it to the ego (egonetwork rep invariant). Context is set to current context and loaded if necessary.
        Parameters:
        contextName - Identifier of the context
        nodeName - Username of the node
        nodeId - Identifier of the new node
        Returns:
        True if the node is added successfully to the context, false if a node with the same username exists or the new node's username corresponds to ego's username
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if contextName or nodeName is null

      • addNode

        public boolean addNode​(java.lang.String nodeName,
                       java.lang.Long nodeId)
        Adds the node to the current context together with the arc that connects it to the ego (egonetwork rep invariant),
        Parameters:
        nodeName - The username of the node
        nodeId - The identifier of the node
        Returns:
        True if the node is added successfully to the context, false if a node with the same username exists or the new node's username corresponds to ego's username
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if nodeName is null
        ContextException - if there is no active context

      • addPerson

        public boolean addPerson​(java.lang.String username,
                         int identifier,
                         java.lang.String firstName,
                         java.lang.String secondName,
                         java.lang.String surname,
                         long birthDate)
        Adds a Person node to the current context
        Parameters:
        username - Username of the node
        identifier - Numeric identifier of the node
        firstName - First name of the person
        secondName - Second name of the person
        surname - Surname of the person
        birthDate - Birth date of the user
        Returns:
        True if the Person is added successfully, false otherwise (if the addNode method fails)
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if username, firstName, secondName or surName are null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if userName, firstName or surname are empty strings
        ContextException - if there is no active context

      • addSmartObject

        public boolean addSmartObject​(java.lang.String username,
                              long id,
                              java.lang.String macAddr,
                              java.lang.String man,
                              java.lang.String own)
        Adds a Smart object node to the current context
        Parameters:
        username - Username of the node
        id - Numeric identifier of the node
        macAddr - MAC Address of the devide
        man - Manufacturer of the device
        own - Name of the owner of the device
        Returns:
        True if the Smart Object is added successfully, false otherwise (if the addNode method fails)
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if username, macAddr, man or own are null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the length of macAddr is different than 12, or if man or own are empty strings
        ContextException - if there is no active context

      • removeNode

        public boolean removeNode​(java.lang.String contextName,
                          java.lang.String nodeName)
        Removes the node from the Context, the ego node can't be removed (egonetwork rep invariant). Context is set to current context and loaded if necessary.
        Parameters:
        contextName - The name of the context from which the node has to be removed
        nodeName - The name of the node that has to be removed
        Returns:
        true if the node has been removed correctly,false if node doesn't exists.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if contextName or nodeName is null

      • removeNode

        public boolean removeNode​(java.lang.String nodeName)
        Removes the node from the current context, the ego node can't be removed (egonetwork rep invariant).
        Parameters:
        nodeName - The name of the node to remove
        Returns:
        true if the node has been removed correctly,false if node doesn't exist in current context.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if nodeName is null
        ContextException - If there is no current context
        NodeException - If the node is the ego (the ego node can't be removed)

      • removeInactive

        public int removeInactive​(double minThreshold)
        Removes all current context nodes with score less than minThreshold
        Parameters:
        minThreshold - The score threshold under which a node is considered inactive
        Returns:
        The number of removed nodes
        Throws:
        ContextException - If there is no current context

      • getScore

        public double getScore​(java.lang.String nodeName)
        Gets the activity score of a node
        Parameters:
        nodeName - Identifier of the node
        Returns:
        The node's activity score, or -1 if the node doesn't belong to current context
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if nodeName is null
        ContextException - if there is no current context

      • getIncomingEdges

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Double> getIncomingEdges​(java.lang.String nodeName)
        Parameters:
        nodeName - Name of the node
        Returns:
        A map containing incoming edges of the node in the current context, where keys are the source nodes' names and values are the edges' weights, i.e. the tie strengths.. Null is returned if node can't be retrieved.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if nodeName is null
        ContextException - If there is no current context

      • getOutgoingEdges

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Double> getOutgoingEdges​(java.lang.String nodeName)
        Parameters:
        nodeName - Name of the node
        Returns:
        A map containing outgoing edges of the node in the current context, where keys are the destination nodes' names and values are the edges' weights, i.e. the tie strengths.. Null is returned if node can't be retrieved.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if nodeName is null
        ContextException - If there is no current context

      • getEgoName

        public java.lang.String getEgoName()
        Gets the name of the ego in the network
        Returns:
        Name of the ego in the network

      • getRecurrencyArray

        public float[][] getRecurrencyArray​(java.lang.String contextName)
        Extracts the percentage of days of the week and hours of the day in which a specific context context has been active N.B: The context needs to be active in order to retrieve this information
        Parameters:
        contextName - Identifier of the context
        Returns:
        A float matrix F where vec[dayOfWeek][hourOfDay] == percentage use of that time slot with respect to the total hours that the context has been active N.B.: F[0] represents sunday
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if contextName is null
        ContextException - if the context is not active

      • NodesJaccardIndex

        public float NodesJaccardIndex​(java.lang.String firstContextName,
                               java.lang.String secondContextName)
        Computes the Jaccard similarity index between two contexts, i.e. the index related to their sets of users
        Parameters:
        firstContextName - The name of the first context whose nodes we want to compute the index for
        secondContextName - The second context whose nodes we want to find the index for
        Returns:
        Jaccard similarity index of context's nodes, -1 if one of the contexts don't have any nodes
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if firstContextName is null or secondContextName is null

      • ContextsJaccardIndex

        public float ContextsJaccardIndex​(java.lang.String firstNodeName,
                                  java.lang.String secondNodeName)
        Computes the Jaccard similarity index between two actors of the CEN, i.e. the index related to the sets of contexts they belong to
        Parameters:
        firstNodeName - The name of the first node whose contexts we want to compute the index for
        secondNodeName - The name of the second node whose contexts we want to compute the index for
        Returns:
        Jaccard similarity index of the node's contexts, -1 if one of the two nodes doesn't exist

      • getContext

        public Context getContext​(java.lang.String contextName)
        Gets a context by its name
        Parameters:
        contextName - The name of the context to be returned
        Returns:
        The context identified by contextname (if active), null otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if contextName is null

      • getNodes

        public java.lang.String[] getNodes​(java.lang.String contextName)
        Gets the nodes of a context
        Parameters:
        contextName - The identifier of the context
        Returns:
        A String vector of nodes contained in this context, null if the context doesn't exists
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if contextName is null

      • getContexts

        public java.lang.String[] getContexts​(java.lang.String nodeName)
        Gets all contexts which a certain node belongs to
        Parameters:
        nodeName - The identifier of the node
        Returns:
        Null if node doesn't exists, a vector of all contexts if nodeName == null, a vector of the contexts where the node is present otherwise.

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive​(java.lang.String contextName)
        Return a boolean value that tells if a context is active or not.
        Parameters:
        contextName - The identifier of the context
        Returns:
        true if the context is active,false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if contextName is null

      • containsNode

        public boolean containsNode​(java.lang.String contextName,
                            java.lang.String nodeName)
        Check if a certain node belongs to a certain context
        Parameters:
        contextName - The identifier of the context
        nodeName - The identifier of the node
        Returns:
        true if node is present in the context, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if contextName or nodeName is null

      • isOnline

        public boolean isOnline​(java.lang.String nodeName)
        Return a boolean that tells if a certain node is online or not in the current context.
        Parameters:
        nodeName - The identifier of the node
        Returns:
        true if the node is online in the current context, false if the node is not online or if it doesn't belong to current context.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if nodeName is null
        ContextException - if there is no current context

      • isOnline

        public boolean isOnline​(java.lang.String contextName,
                        java.lang.String nodeName)
        Gets the online status of a node in a specific context, identified by contextName. The context is set to current context and loaded if necessary.
        Parameters:
        contextName - The identifier of the context
        nodeName - The identifier of the node
        Returns:
        true if the node is online in the current context, false if the node is not online or if it doesn't belong to that context.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if contextName or nodeName is null

      • setOnline

        public void setOnline​(java.lang.String contextName,
                      java.lang.String nodeName,
                      boolean value)
        Sets a node online in a context, which is set to current context and loaded if necessary.
        Parameters:
        contextName - The identifier of the context
        nodeName - The identifier of the node
        value - true to set online, false to set offline
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if contextName or nodeName is null

      • setOnline

        public void setOnline​(java.lang.String nodeName,
                      boolean value)
        Sets a node online in the current context
        Parameters:
        nodeName - The identifier of the node
        value - true to set online, false to set offline
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if nodeName is null
        ContextException - If there is no current context

      • getEdgeWeight

        public java.lang.Double getEdgeWeight​(java.lang.String srcName,
                                      java.lang.String dstName)
        Gets the weight of an edge, i.e. the tie strength
        Parameters:
        srcName - The identifier of the source node
        dstName - The identifier of the destination node
        Returns:
        Weight of the edge in current context (if src, dst and edge exist in current context), null otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if srcName or dstName are null
        ContextException - If there is no current context

      • getEdgeTimestamp

        public long getEdgeTimestamp​(java.lang.String srcName,
                             java.lang.String dstName)
        Gets the timestamp of an edge
        Parameters:
        srcName - The identifier of the source node
        dstName - The identifier of the destination node
        Returns:
        timeStamp of the edge (if exist src,dst and edge)in the current context. -2 if a node doesn't exists, -1 if the edge doesn't exists.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if srcName or dstName are null
        ContextException - If there is no current context

      • Reset

        public void Reset()
        Resets this instance (all context files will be deleted)

      • cleanAnalyticsData

        public void cleanAnalyticsData()
        Deletes the analytics context data directory

      • cleanContextData

        public void cleanContextData()
        Deletes the context data directory

      • addCustomDeserializer

        public <V extends CustomDeserializer> void addCustomDeserializer​(java.lang.Class<?> myClass,
                                                                 V deserializer)
        Adds a custom deserializer for the clazz's type. registered customSerializers are not persistent, for subsequent instances they will have to be registered again.
        Type Parameters:
        V - The class of the deserializer
        Parameters:
        myClass - The class for which we want to add a deserializer
        deserializer - myClass custom deserializer

      • removeCustomDeserializer

        public void removeCustomDeserializer​(java.lang.Class<?> myClass)
        Removes the serializer registered for myClass
        Parameters:
        myClass - The class for which we want to remove a deserializer

      • getCustomSerializableClassNames

        public java.lang.String[] getCustomSerializableClassNames()
        Gets all the class names that are registered for serialization
        Returns:
        A vector of class names registered for serialization

      • getCustomDeserializer

        public java.lang.Object getCustomDeserializer​(java.lang.Class<?> myClass)
        Gets the custom deserializer registered for the class myClass
        Parameters:
        myClass - The class for which we want to get the deserializer
        Returns:
        A custom serializer for the class myClass

                          throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Sets an attachment on the current context
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the attachment
        Parameters:
        data - The attachment to be set
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if there is no custom deserializer registered for the attachment's type

      • getDataOfContext

        public java.lang.Object getDataOfContext()
                                  throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Gets the object data of current context
        Returns:
        the current context attachment
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if there is no custom deserializer registered for the attachment's type

      • getDataOfNode

        public java.lang.Object getDataOfNode​(java.lang.String nodeName)
                               throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Gets the object data of a specific node in current context
        Parameters:
        nodeName - The node we want to get the data of
        Returns:
        node's attachment in the current context.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if there is no custom deserializer registered for the attachment's type
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if nodeName is null
        ContextException - if there is no current context

      • setDataOfNode

        public <T> void setDataOfNode​(java.lang.String nodeName,
                              T data)
                       throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Sets an attachment on a node in the current context.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the object attachment to be set
        Parameters:
        nodeName - The identifier of a node
        data - The attachment to be set
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if there is no custom deserializer registered for the attachment's type
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if nodeName or data is null
        ContextException - if there is no current context
